message.content: This question requires knowledge about the properties of rubber. Rubber is a good insulator and can help prevent heat from spreading. Option (B) is incorrect because rubber actually allows balls to bounce due to its elasticity. Option (C) is incorrect because rubber is commonly used for wheels to help them roll smoothly. Option (D) is incorrect because rubber can provide friction, which actually helps pucks slide across a surface.

This question requires some basic knowledge about the properties of rubber. Rubber is an insulator, which means it has low thermal conductivity. That means it can prevent heat from spreading or transferring easily. Option (B) is incorrect because rubber is known for its elastic properties, which actually make balls bounce. Option (C) is incorrect because rubber is commonly used in wheels to improve traction and facilitate rolling. Option (D) is incorrect because rubber is not typically used to prevent pucks from sliding, as it would reduce their movement on surfaces like ice.
